What to expect from the new US consulate in Bengaluru - The Indian Express
summary:
What to Expect from the New US Consulate in Bengaluru

Published on: January 16, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Bengaluru will have the fifth United States consulate in India, focusing on strengthening economic and political relations. A site-dedication ceremony was held on January 17.

  • This consulate aims to harness benefits of investment and trade between the US and India.
  • Visa services are not expected to start immediately, but they'll eventually ease the burden on other consulates, especially in Chennai.
  • The consulate will operate from the US Commercial Service (USCS) office in Bengaluru.
  • It's estimated that around 450 visa applications come from South Karnataka to Chennai daily.
"The establishment of a US consulate in Bengaluru is expected to benefit all US-headquartered companies in Karnataka."

The new consulate is important for strengthening ties between the US and Karnataka, with long-term benefits expected for business and tourism.
newTitle: What to Expect from the New US Consulate in Bengaluru

Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim leaks: Design, battery, display, and everything else to know - India Today
summary:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim Leaks: Design, Battery, Display, and Key Features

Published On: Jan 17, 2025
Published By: Aman Rashid

The Galaxy S25 Slim is set to launch alongside the Galaxy S25 series on January 22, promising a sleek design coupled with advanced specifications. Expect a focus on a super thin profile, potentially affecting battery performance.

  • The Galaxy S25 Slim measures approximately 6.4mm in thickness, making it the thinnest in the S25 series.
  • It will feature a display size between 6.7 inches and 6.8 inches.
  • Battery capacity is rumored to be between 3,000 mAh and 4,000 mAh.
  • Equipped with Qualcomm’s Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and 12GB of RAM.
  • Camera setup includes a 200-megapixel primary camera, a 50-megapixel ultra-wide camera, and a 50-megapixel telephoto camera.
“Questions remain about whether the trade-offs for the slimness will be worth it.”

As the Galaxy S25 Slim nears its reveal, its performance and battery life will be closely watched by consumers eager for a compact yet powerful smartphone.
newTitle: Samsung Galaxy S25 Slim Leaks: Design, Battery, Display, and Key Features

Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan, wife Bushra Bibi convicted in al-Qadir Trust case - The Hindu
summary:
Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan, wife Bushra Bibi convicted in al-Qadir Trust case

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

A Pakistan court sentenced former Prime Minister Imran Khan to 14 years in prison and his wife Bushra Bibi to 7 years for corruption related to the al-Qadir Trust case, involving losses of 190 million pounds.

  • The verdict, delivered by Judge Nasir Javed Rana, resulted from a case initiated by the National Accountability Bureau (NAB) in December 2023.
  • Khan and Bibi were fined and face additional imprisonment if they fail to pay.
  • The conviction has raised concerns about the integrity of the judiciary according to Khan's comments.
  • This ruling adds to Khan's legal troubles since his ouster as PM in 2022, as he faces numerous pending cases.
  • The political situation remains tense as negotiations are ongoing between the government and Khan’s political party, PTI.
“Today’s verdict has tarnished the reputation of the judiciary...” - Imran Khan

The conviction of Khan and Bibi represents both a legal and a political crisis in Pakistan, further complicating the country's already unstable governance.
newTitle: Imran Khan and Bushra Bibi Convicted in Corruption Case

title: Union Budget 2025: Govt may introduce personal income tax breaks, says report - Moneycontrol
Supreme Court Stays HC Order Requiring Delhi Govt To Sign MoU With Centre On Implementation Of PM-ABHIM... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Stays HC Order Requiring Delhi Govt To Sign MoU With Centre On Implementation Of PM-ABHIM

Publication Date: Today

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has temporarily stayed a Delhi High Court order mandating the Delhi government to sign a Memorandum of Understanding with the Centre for the implementation of the PM-Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) scheme.

  • The Supreme Court stayed the order of the Delhi High Court which aimed to accelerate the health infrastructure in Delhi via PM-ABHIM.
  • The Delhi government challenged the High Court's directive, arguing it overstepped the Centre's powers regarding health matters.
  • Senior Advocate Dr Abhishek Manu Singhvi defended the Delhi government, stating that the proposed MoU unfairly limited running expenditure responsibilities.
  • The High Court had expressed urgency over the lack of medical facilities in Delhi and insisted on the scheme's implementation.
  • The bench directed the Centre to respond to the Delhi government's plea.
The High Court had a suo motu PIL regarding ICU bed availability and criticized the delay in implementing PM-ABHIM in Delhi, contrasting it with 33 other States/UTs that have already implemented it.

The Supreme Court's decision to stay the High Court's order indicates ongoing legal challenges regarding the implementation of crucial health infrastructure schemes in Delhi amid concerns of medical resource shortages.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Delhi High Court Order on PM-ABHIM Implementation

title: Supreme Court Pauses High Court Order Over Ayushman Bharat Scheme In Delhi - NDTV
summary:
Supreme Court Pauses High Court Order Over Ayushman Bharat Scheme In Delhi

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court has temporarily halted a Delhi High Court ruling that mandated the Delhi government to execute a Memorandum of Understanding to facilitate the implementation of the Ayushman Bharat Health Infrastructure Mission (PM-ABHIM) scheme.

  • The Supreme Court issued notices to the central government, AIIMS, and the Municipal Corporation of Delhi in response to a petition from the Delhi government against the High Court ruling.
  • Last month, the Delhi High Court ordered the MoU to be signed by January 5.
  • The AAP government argues against the scheme, claiming that Delhi has better benefits under its own health schemes.
  • This issue could escalate political tensions between the BJP and AAP ahead of crucial government elections in the city.
  • The Delhi government's counsel contends that signing the MoU would overstep the central government’s authority regarding health policy.
The High Court stated, “Not implementing the ABHIM Scheme in Delhi would not be justified since 33 States and UTs have already implemented it.”

This development highlights ongoing political friction regarding health policy and governance between the central and Delhi state authorities.
newTitle: Supreme Court Pauses Implementation of Ayushman Bharat Scheme in Delhi

title: US Consulate inaugurated in Bengaluru, visa services to start soon, says Eric Garcetti - Hindustan Times
summary:
US Consulate inaugurated in Bengaluru, visa services to start soon, says Eric Garcetti

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The United States has officially inaugurated its consulate in Bengaluru with plans to start visa services soon. This was marked by a ceremony led by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar and US Ambassador Eric Garcetti.

  • The consulate will initially operate from a temporary location at the JW Marriott Hotel.
  • Jaishankar emphasized the importance of having a permanent US diplomatic presence in Bengaluru.
  • Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar called the opening a significant event.
  • BJP MP Tejasvi Surya noted the consulate's importance for local residents.
  • Garcetti confirmed that visa services will commence in the future.
“It has been something long in waiting...” - S Jaishankar

The establishment of the consulate underscores Bengaluru's global importance, with a commitment from the US to enhance its diplomatic presence in India.
newTitle: US Consulate Inaugurated in Bengaluru, Visa Services Coming Soon

title: Arvind Kejriwal writes to PM Narendra Modi, proposes 50% concession for students in Delhi Metro, free bus - The Times of India
summary:
Kejriwal Suggests 50% Fare Discount for Delhi Metro Students and Free Bus Rides

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposing a 50% fare concession for students using the Delhi Metro and free bus rides to enhance education access.

  • The proposal aims to ease financial burdens on students.
  • Kejriwal emphasizes the importance of affordable transportation for educational success.
  • The request is aimed at benefitting a large number of students in Delhi.
“Affordable transportation is crucial for students to pursue their education successfully,” Kejriwal stated.

This proposal seeks to address the high transportation costs faced by students in the capital, potentially making education more accessible.

India Star's Champions Trophy Spot In Danger As Domestic Cricket Absence Angers BCCI: Report - NDTV Sports
summary:
Sanju Samson's Absence from Domestic Cricket Raises Concerns Ahead of Champions Trophy

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

Sanju Samson's decision to skip the Vijay Hazare Trophy for Kerala may jeopardize his selection for the Champions Trophy. The BCCI emphasizes the importance of domestic cricket for national players, and Samson's absence has led to discontent among selectors.

  • Sanju Samson's non-participation in the Vijay Hazare Trophy could cost him a spot in the Champions Trophy.
  • BCCI has clearly stated that players must participate in domestic competitions to be eligible for international selection.
  • Samson has faced issues with his state team, the Kerala Cricket Association, which may hinder his domestic play.
  • The current leading wicket-keeping options for the Champions Trophy are Rishabh Pant and Dhruv Jurel, with Samson trailing behind.
  • Selectors are looking for valid reasons for Samson's absence, which remains unclear.
“The selectors would want a valid reason. Otherwise, it will be difficult to consider him for the ODI season.” - BCCI sources

This situation highlights the tension between individual choices and team obligations in professional sports, especially in cricket where domestic performance heavily influences national selection.
newTitle: Sanju Samson's Absence from Domestic Cricket Raises Concerns Ahead of Champions Trophy

title: National Sports Awards: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, Praveen Kumar receive Khel Ratna from President Murmu - The Hindu
summary:
National Sports Awards: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, Praveen Kumar receive Khel Ratna

Publication Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The National Sports Awards ceremony in New Delhi honored outstanding athletes with the prestigious Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna award. This year’s recipients include Manu Bhaker, D. Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, and Praveen Kumar, all celebrated for their remarkable achievements in sports.

  • Manu Bhaker became the first athlete from independent India to win two medals in a single Olympics.
  • D. Gukesh, at 18, is the youngest ever World Chess Champion.
  • Harmanpreet Singh captained the Indian hockey team to bronze medals in both the Tokyo and Paris Olympics.
  • Praveen Kumar secured gold in the high jump at the Paris Paralympics.
  • A record number of para-athletes received the Arjuna Award this year, with 17 out of 32 awards going to them.
“The para-athletes outnumbered the able-bodied ones in the list of Arjuna winners this time due to the magnificent Paris Paralympics performance.”

The awards ceremony, characterized by vibrant celebrations of sportsmanship, highlights India's growing recognition of diverse athletic talent, particularly in Paralympics and Olympic events.
newTitle: National Sports Awards: Manu Bhaker, Gukesh, Harmanpreet Singh, Praveen Kumar receive Khel Ratna

title: Realme to supercharge smartphone design with 300% boost to ID talent, 450% R&D investment in 2025 | Exclusive - The Financial Express
summary:
Realme to Boost Smartphone Design and R&D Investments by 2025

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: financialexpress.com

Realme's founder and CEO, Sky Li, discusses the company's ambitious plans for 2025, including a 450% increase in R&D investment and a 300% boost in Industrial Design talent. The Realme 14 Pro series, aimed at tech-savvy youth, focuses on innovation, design aesthetics, and advanced camera capabilities.

  • The target market for the Realme 14 Pro series consists of young adults valuing innovation and performance.
  • Realme aims to enhance user experience with India-specific software and colour variants.
  • Notable growth in 2024 included an 117% rise in Western Europe and 281% in Latin America.
  • The 14 Pro series focuses on high-performance features like advanced camera technology and impressive battery life.
  • Significant investment in quad-curved display technology emphasizing user experience.

“India remains a key pillar of our success, where we [have] reinforced our position as the most popular smartphone brand among the youth.” - Sky Li

The Realme 14 Pro series showcases the company’s focus on innovation, targeting an expansion in both local and global markets. Their commitment to R&D will significantly influence future smartphone design and user experience.
newTitle: Realme to Boost Smartphone Design and R&D Investments by 2025

TikTok ban: Biden hands over Chinese app's fate to Trump before White House exit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Biden Hands Over TikTok's Fate to Trump Ahead of Exit

Publication Date: Date not specified | Source: Hindustan Times

As President Biden prepares to leave office, he will not enforce a TikTok ban enacted by Congress, transferring the decision to President-elect Trump, who has previously expressed both support and opposition to the app.

  • Biden will not enforce the upcoming TikTok ban before his departure.
  • The law requires TikTok's parent company, ByteDance, to divest by January 19.
  • Trump's administration may work to extend the deadline for a potential deal.
  • Senate leaders showed bipartisan support for extending the deadline to avoid disruption for users.
  • The Supreme Court is considering a legal challenge to the TikTok ban.
Chuck Schumer stated, “It’s clear that more time is needed to find an American buyer and not disrupt the lives and livelihoods of millions of Americans.”

As TikTok's future remains uncertain, it will be crucial to watch how the new administration handles the app's potential ban and its implications for users and the digital landscape.
newTitle: Biden Hands Over TikTok's Fate to Trump Ahead of Exit

title: Making cancer care more affordable in India - Hindustan Times
summary:
Making Cancer Care More Affordable in India

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses the progress made in cancer care in India with efforts aimed at improving accessibility and affordability. It emphasizes the need for further measures to enhance the quality of care and reduce costs, especially in light of the upcoming Union Budget 2025.

  • Government has exempted three cancer medicines from customs duty in the last budget.
  • The upcoming Union Budget presents an opportunity to invest in infrastructure and local manufacturing of medicines.
  • Ayushman Bharat scheme aims to provide health coverage, but gaps in public awareness about health insurance persist.
  • The economic impact of cancer treatment costs approximately ₹75,000 crore annually.
  • High import duties on medical equipment contribute to the high costs of cancer care.
  • Local manufacturing and reducing profit margins on medicines are necessary for affordable treatment.
  • Prevention and quality primary health care are crucial for addressing cancer effectively.
Cancer treatment has become increasingly complex, requiring specialized treatments and doctors, raising costs significantly.

In conclusion, addressing the affordability of cancer care in India requires a holistic approach, including policy changes, investment in infrastructure, and greater public awareness.
newTitle: Making Cancer Care More Affordable in India

title: Coldplay's Republic Day gift to India: Ahmedabad concert will be streamed live on Jan 26. Here's where to watch - Hindustan Times
summary:

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Coldplay has made a special announcement after landing in India, promising to stream their Ahmedabad concert live on January 26, 2025, on Disney+ Hotstar.

  • The band will perform in Mumbai from January 18 to 21, 2025.
  • Chris Martin expressed excitement for the Indian audience during the live announcement.
  • Special train services have been arranged for fans traveling between Mumbai and Ahmedabad due to high demand and soaring airfares.
  • The concerts are organized by BookMyShow Live.
“Namaste to all our friends in India. We are so happy to tell you that on the 26th of January, our show from Ahmedabad is streaming live on Disney+ Hotstar.” - Chris Martin

This concert marks a significant moment for both Coldplay and their Indian fans, bringing a unique experience celebrating Republic Day.
newTitle: Coldplay's Republic Day Gift to India: Live Streaming of Ahmedabad Concert

Fatality ratio of up to 88%, 8 suspected cases: WHO, Tanzania disagree over Marburg virus outbreak - Mathrubhumi English
summary:
Fatality ratio of up to 88%, 8 suspected cases: WHO, Tanzania disagree over Marburg virus outbreak

Published on: January 15, 2025 | Source: Mathrubhumi

The World Health Organisation (WHO) reported that eight suspected cases of Marburg disease resulted in fatalities in northern Tanzania, while Tanzanian officials disputed these claims, asserting that laboratory tests returned negative for the virus.

  • The WHO identified nine cases, with eight resulting in death.
  • Tanzania's Health Minister stated all tests for the Marburg virus were negative as of January 15, 2025.
  • Tanzanian health authorities deployed experts to investigate and confirm the situation.
  • The Marburg virus, similar to Ebola, has a fatality rate of up to 88% without treatment.
  • The WHO categorized the risk from the suspected outbreak as high at the national level but low globally.
“We would expect further cases in the coming days as disease surveillance improves.” - Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Chief

This situation highlights the need for continued vigilance and accurate reporting around infectious disease outbreaks, particularly in regions at risk.
newTitle: WHO and Tanzania Disagree on Marburg Virus Outbreak Reports
